column1: Bollate (Milanese: Bollaa [buˈlɑː]) is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Milan in the Italian region Lombardy
column2: located about 10 kilometres (6 mi) northwest of Milan.

column1: Bollate borders the following municipalities: Paderno Dugnano
Bollate received the honorary title of city with a presidential decree on October 11
It is served by Bollate Centro railway station and Bollate Nord railway station. Sights include the historical Villa Arconati.
